meta.name: description
meta.content: The 307 Temporary Redirect HTTP status code tells clients to re-issue the request at a different URI.

main.p: The 307 Temporary Redirect HTTP status code tells clients the request was not filled, and to re-issue the request at a different URI.
Servers should produce 307 Temporary Redirect when a request should be re-made to a different URI, especially a different authority or server.
307 Temporary Redirect is an indication the request was not filled, and that this must be issued at a different location. The client must otherwise make the same request, including the same method.

dl.dd: The request must be re-made at a different URI.

dd.a: RFC 7538: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol Status Code 307 (Permanent Redirect)
